text: Hello, I'm a biologist (postdoc) at Massachusetts General Hospital. I've been using Julia for about a year on my computational project analyzing superresolution microscopy data after I realized how slow MATLAB was (parsing strings when passing arguments was taking up so much processing power!). I developed an ANOVA package (SimpleANOVA.jl), and I've also got a PR pending for Julia to provide for an n-dimensional array concatenation syntax.

text: Anova has been asked for many times. Did you see the discourse posts on it? You might be shaping up to be a popular gentleman with some of the users here ;) join <#C6821M4KE|statistics> if youre not already there

text: Thanks Kevin! I've had delusions of wanting to make biological computing better for a while so I'll be looking for ways to help here.

text: Once this whole pandemic thing winds down we should organize some biology julia users meet ups or something :smile:. It'll be you and me, and probably <@UB7JS9CHF> will come just for giggles.
